intro: Acronia hemileuca, commonly known as the white-veined acronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with white veins and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
